docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: How to create a blog in markdown?
docs.text:
This is an instruction to create a blog post in markdown format

  1. Use the blog plugin from material-mkdocs
  2. Create a folder structure: 
    root
|-- docs
  |-- index.md
  |-- blog
     |-- index.md
     |-- posts
       |-- post1.md
       |-- post2.md
    3/. Add the metadata in the front of the blog: 
    ---
draft: true 
date: 2024-01-31 
categories:
  - Hello
  - World
---

docs.title: Hello world!
docs.text:
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa.

...

docs.title: This file contains example markdown content
docs.text:
This is used to test how this markdown to HTML extension works with all basic markdown components.

Advertisement :)

  • pica - high quality and fast image resize in browser.
  • babelfish - developer friendly i18n with plurals support and easy syntax.

You will like those projects!

docs.title: Typographic replacements
docs.text:
Enable typographer option to see result.

(c) (C) (r) (R) (tm) (TM) (p) (P) +-

test.. test... test..... test?..... test!....

!!!!!! ???? ,, -- ---

"Smartypants, double quotes" and 'single quotes'

docs.title: Blockquotes
docs.text:
Blockquotes can also be nested...

...by using additional greater-than signs right next to each other...

...or with spaces between arrows.

docs.title: Lists
docs.text:
Unordered

  • Create a list by starting a line with +, -, or *
  • Sub-lists are made by indenting 2 spaces:
  • Marker character change forces new list start:
    • Ac tristique libero volutpat at
    • Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet
    • Nulla volutpat aliquam velit
  • Very easy!

Ordered

  1. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
  2. Consectetur adipiscing elit

  3. Integer molestie lorem at massa

  4. You can use sequential numbers...

  5. ...or keep all the numbers as 1.

Start numbering with offset:

  1. foo
  2. bar

docs.title: Code
docs.text:
Inline code

Indented code

// Some comments
line 1 of code
line 2 of code
line 3 of code

Block code "fences"

Sample text here...

Syntax highlighting

var foo = function (bar) {
  return bar++;
};

console.log(foo(5));

docs.title: Tables
docs.text:
Option Description data path to data files to supply the data that will be passed into templates. engine engine to be used for processing templates. Handlebars is the default. ext extension to be used for dest files.

Right aligned columns

Option Description data path to data files to supply the data that will be passed into templates. engine engine to be used for processing templates. Handlebars is the default. ext extension to be used for dest files.

docs.title: Images
docs.text:
Like links, Images also have a footnote style syntax

With a reference later in the document defining the URL location:

docs.title: Plugins
docs.text: The killer feature of markdown-it is very effective support of syntax plugins.

docs.title: Emojies
docs.text:
Classic markup: :wink: :cry: :laughing: :yum:

Shortcuts (emoticons): :-) :-( 8-) ;)

see how to change output with twemoji.

docs.title:
Footnotes

Footnote 1 link[^first].

Footnote 2 link[^second].

Inline footnote^[Text of inline footnote] definition.

Duplicated footnote reference[^second].

[^first]: Footnote can have markup

and multiple paragraphs.

[^second]: Footnote text.

Definition lists Term 1

Definition 1 with lazy continuation.

Term 2 with inline markup

Definition 2

{ some code, part of Definition 2 }

Third paragraph of definition 2.

Compact style:

Term 1 ~ Definition 1

Term 2 ~ Definition 2a ~ Definition 2b

Abbreviations

This is HTML abbreviation example.

It converts "HTML", but keep intact partial entries like "xxxHTMLyyy" and so on.

*[HTML]: Hyper Text Markup Language

Custom containers

::: warning here be dragons :::

Mermaid extension: 
  graph TD;
      A-->B;
      A-->C;
      B-->D;
      C-->D;
pie title Which animals do you prefer as pets?
    "Dogs" : 386
    "Cats" : 85
    "Rabbits" : 53
    "Hamsters" : 101
sequenceDiagram
  autonumber
  Alice->>John: Hello John, how are you?
  loop Healthcheck
      John->>John: Fight against hypochondria
  end
  Note right of John: Rational thoughts!
  John-->>Alice: Great!
  John->>Bob: How about you?
  Bob-->>John: Jolly good!

Using list

  • Nulla et rhoncus turpis. Mauris ultricies elementum leo. Duis efficitur accumsan nibh eu mattis. Vivamus tempus velit eros, porttitor placerat nibh lacinia sed. Aenean in finibus diam.

    • Duis mollis est eget nibh volutpat, fermentum aliquet dui mollis.
    • Nam vulputate tincidunt fringilla.
    • Nullam dignissim ultrices urna non auctor.
